subtitle: An Indian snack that can be eaten hot or cold for lunch.

method.text: Sift the flour and salt in a bowl. Rub in the oil. Slowly mix in the water. Add a little extra if necessary so the dough is gathered into a fairly stiff ball.
Knead well on a clean surface for about 10 min until it is really smooth. Rub with a little oil and leave in a polythene bag to rest for at least 20 min.
Meanwhile, make the filling: Heat the oil and fry the onions. Add curry powder, cook for 1 min. Add peas, ginger, chilli and water. Cook slowly for 3 min to just cook the peas.
Add remaining ingredients and cook for 3-4 min. Allow to cool a little.
Divide dough into pieces (allow 2 per serving). Carefully roll each to approximately13 cm square.

Brush a sandwich toaster with melted butter. Place 2 pieces of dough onto the preheated toaster. Top well with some of the filling and cover with 2 more pieces of dough. Lower lid and cook for about 4 min, brushing with butter during the cooking, until golden brown and crispy.
Keep warm while you make samosas with the remainder of the dough and filling.

title: Samosas
